column4: principle_description
column5: question
column8: quote
column12: Start with customer and work backwards
column13: Tell me about a time when you had to make a decision that was right for the customer but difficult for your business. How did you handle it?
column16: Leaders start with the customer and work backwards. They work vigorously to earn and keep customer trust. Although leaders pay attention to competitors, they obsess over customers.

column4: Act on behalf of the entire company beyond just your own team
column5: Describe a situation where you took ownership of a problem that wasn't directly your responsibility. What was the outcome?
column8: Leaders are owners. They think long term and don't sacrifice long-term value for short-term results. They act on behalf of the entire company, beyond just their own team. They never say 'that's not my job.'

column4: Look for new ideas and ways to simplify
column5: Give me an example of when you took a complex process and made it simple. What was your approach?
column8: Leaders expect and require innovation and invention from their teams and always find ways to simplify. They are externally aware, look for new ideas from everywhere, and are not limited by 'not invented here.'

column4: Have strong business judgment and good instincts
column5: Tell me about a time when you were wrong about something important. How did you handle it?
column8: Leaders are right a lot. They have strong judgment and good instincts. They seek diverse perspectives and work to disconfirm their beliefs.

column4: Never done learning and always seek to improve yourself
column5: Describe a time when you realized you needed to learn something new to be effective in your role. How did you approach it?
column8: Leaders are never done learning and always seek to improve themselves. They are curious about new possibilities and act to explore them.

column4: Raise the performance bar with every hire and promotion
column5: Tell me about a time when you had to make a difficult hiring decision. Walk me through your thought process.
column8: Leaders raise the performance bar with every hire and promotion. They recognize exceptional talent, and willingly move them throughout the organization. Leaders develop leaders and take seriously their role in coaching others.

column4: Have relentlessly high standards
column5: Give me an example of when you pushed back on a deliverable because it didn't meet your standards. How did you handle the situation?
column8: Leaders have relentlessly high standards — many people may think these standards are unreasonably high. Leaders are continually raising the bar and drive their teams to deliver high quality products, services, and processes.

column4: Create and communicate bold direction that inspires results
column5: Describe a time when you proposed an idea that others thought was too ambitious. How did you approach it?
column8: Thinking small is a self-fulfilling prophecy. Leaders create and communicate a bold direction that inspires results. They think differently and look around corners for ways to serve customers.

column4: Speed matters in business
column5: Tell me about a time when you had to make a decision with incomplete information. How did you proceed?
column8: Speed matters in business. Many decisions and actions are reversible and do not need extensive study. We value calculated risk taking.

column4: Accomplish more with less
column5: Describe a situation where you had to deliver results with limited resources. How did you approach it?
column8: Accomplish more with less. Constraints breed resourcefulness, self-sufficiency, and invention. There are no extra points for growing headcount, budget size, or fixed expense.

column4: Listen attentively speak candidly and treat others respectfully
column5: Tell me about a time when you had to rebuild trust with a colleague or customer after a mistake.
column8: Leaders listen attentively, speak candidly, and treat others respectfully. They are vocally self-critical, even when doing so is awkward or embarrassing.

column4: Stay connected to the details audit frequently and be skeptical
column5: Give me an example of when you identified a problem by diving deep into data or details that others missed.
column8: Leaders operate at all levels, stay connected to the details, audit frequently, and are skeptical when metrics and anecdote differ.

column4: Challenge decisions when you disagree even when doing so is uncomfortable
column5: Describe a time when you disagreed with your manager's decision but committed to executing it anyway.
column8: Leaders are obligated to respectfully challenge decisions when they disagree, even when doing so is uncomfortable or exhausting. Leaders have conviction and are tenacious.

column4: Focus on the key inputs for your business and deliver them with the right quality
column5: Tell me about a time when you had to deliver results despite significant obstacles.
column8: Leaders focus on the key inputs for their business and deliver them with the right quality and in a timely fashion. Despite setbacks, they rise to the occasion and never settle.

column3: Strive to be Earth's Best Employer
column4: Create a safer productive higher-performing more diverse and more just work environment
column5: Describe how you've contributed to creating an inclusive work environment.
column8: Leaders work every day to create a safer, more productive, higher-performing, more diverse, and more just work environment.

column3: Success and Scale Bring Broad Responsibility
column4: We started in a garage but we're not there anymore
column5: Tell me about a time when you had to consider the broader impact of your work on society or communities.
column8: We started in a garage, but we're not there anymore. We are big, we impact the world, and we are far from perfect. We must be humble and thoughtful about even the secondary effects of our actions.

column4: Trust is our number one value
column5: Tell me about a time when you had to make a decision that prioritized long-term trust over short-term gains.
column8: Trust is our #1 value. Trust is the foundation for everything we do. We build trust through transparency, security, compliance, privacy, and performance.

column4: We measure our success by our customers' success
column5: Describe a situation where you went above and beyond to ensure a customer achieved their goals.
column8: We measure our success by our customers' success. Nothing is more important than our customers' success.

column4: Continuous innovation is what inspires us
column5: Give me an example of when you challenged the status quo to drive innovation in your role.
column8: Continuous innovation is what inspires us. We strive to improve the state of the world through our platform and technology.

column4: Equality is a core value that drives our decisions
column5: Tell me about a time when you championed equality and inclusive practices in your organization.
column8: Equality is a core value that drives every decision we make. We believe that business is the greatest platform for change.

column4: Build systems and relationships based on trust
column5: Describe a time when you had to rebuild trust after a system or process failure.
column8: Trust is not just our #1 value, it's the foundation that everything else is built upon. Without trust, nothing else matters.

column4: Put customers at the center of everything we do
column5: Tell me about a complex customer problem you solved that required cross-functional collaboration.
column8: Our customers are our greatest teachers. We learn from them every day and that learning drives our innovation.
column9: Bret Taylor, Former President & COO, All Hands 2022

column4: Think differently to create breakthrough solutions
column5: Describe a time when you used creative thinking to solve a problem.
column8: Innovation is about thinking differently and being willing to challenge conventional wisdom to create breakthrough solutions.

column4: Put our members at the center of everything we do
column5: Tell me about a time when you prioritized user needs over business convenience.
column8: We put our members first. Every decision we make should create value for our members and help them connect to opportunity.

column4: Build authentic professional relationships
column5: Describe how you've built and maintained a professional network that created mutual value.
column8: Relationships matter. We believe in the power of authentic relationships to unlock opportunities and drive economic growth.

column4: Communicate with transparency and respect
column5: Give me an example of when you had to give difficult feedback while maintaining a positive relationship.
column8: We are open, honest, and constructive. We believe in direct communication and constructive feedback to drive growth and excellence.

column4: Set high standards and continuously improve
column5: Tell me about a time when you raised the bar for performance in your team.
column8: We demand excellence from ourselves and each other. We set high standards and continuously strive to exceed them.

column4: Design experiences that truly serve our members
column5: Describe a situation where you made a difficult trade-off to better serve end users.
column8: Everything we do should create value for our members. If it doesn't help our members connect to economic opportunity, we shouldn't do it.
column9: Reid Hoffman, Founder Philosophy, The Start-up of You, 2012

column4: Leverage the power of professional networks
column5: Tell me about how you've used relationship-building to achieve a complex business objective.
column8: The currency of real networking is not greed but generosity. Professional relationships are built on mutual value creation.

column4: Make decisions based on what's right not what's easy
column5: Tell me about a time when you chose to do the right thing even though it was more difficult.
column8: We do the right thing, period. This means we make decisions based on what's right, not what's easy or convenient.

column4: Obsess over our customers and their experience
column5: Describe a situation where you improved a customer experience through attention to detail.
column8: We obsess over our customers - riders, drivers, eaters, and merchants. Everything we do should make their experience better.

column4: Think globally while acting locally
column5: Give me an example of how you've adapted a global solution for local market needs.
column8: We build globally. We take the best ideas from around the world and adapt them to local markets and cultures.
column9: Uber Global Expansion Principles, Strategy Document, 2023

column4: Lead with integrity in all decisions
column5: Tell me about a time when you had to make a decision that balanced multiple stakeholder interests ethically.
column8: Doing the right thing is non-negotiable. As leaders, we must model the integrity and ethical behavior we expect from others.

column4: Bring your authentic self to work
column5: Tell me about a time when being authentic helped you connect with colleagues or customers.
column8: Be yourself. We believe that diversity of thought comes from diversity of background and perspective. Be authentic.
column9: Spotify Culture Manifesto, Work Life Balance Blog, 2023

column4: Approach work with curiosity and experimentation
column5: Describe how you've used experimentation to improve a process or product.
column8: Play. We approach our work with curiosity and experimentation. We're not afraid to try new things and learn from failure.

column4: Set ambitious goals and pursue breakthrough innovations
column5: Give me an example of when you set an ambitious goal that others thought was unrealistic.
column8: Dream big. We set audacious goals and aren't afraid to pursue breakthrough innovations that can change how the world experiences audio.
column9: Gustav Söderström, CPO Keynote, Stream On Event, 2024

column4: Build each other up through collaboration and learning
column5: Tell me about how you've developed talent while scaling rapidly.
column8: Grow fast, together. We believe in building each other up through collaboration, learning, and shared success.
column9: Spotify People & Culture Principles, HR Documentation, 2023

column4: Put creativity and design at the center of everything
column5: Tell me about a time when you applied creative thinking to solve a business problem.
column8: Creativity and design are at the center of everything we do. We believe creativity is for everyone and design can change the world.

column4: Deeply understand and anticipate customer needs
column5: Describe how you've used customer insights to drive decision-making.
column8: We are customer obsessed. We deeply understand our customers' needs and anticipate what they'll need before they know it themselves.

column4: Champion design excellence in all solutions
column5: Give me an example of when you influenced others to prioritize design quality.
column8: Design is not just what it looks like and feels like. Design is how it works. We champion design excellence in everything we create.
column9: Adobe Design Philosophy, Creative Cloud Blog, 2024

column4: Drive innovation based on deep customer understanding
column5: Tell me about a time when customer insights led you to pivot strategy significantly.
column8: Our obsession with customers drives everything. The best innovations come from deeply understanding unmet customer needs.

column4: Put clients' interests first
column5: Tell me about a time when you prioritized a client's needs over internal convenience.
column8: Our clients' interests always come first. Our experience shows that if we serve our clients well, our own success will follow.
column9: Goldman Sachs Business Principles, Company Handbook, 2024

column4: Maintain the highest ethical standards
column5: Describe a situation where you had to navigate a complex ethical dilemma.
column8: Integrity and honesty are at the heart of our business. We expect our people to maintain high ethical standards in everything they do.
column9: David Solomon, CEO Message, Annual Report, 2023

column4: Strive for excellence in everything we do
column5: Give me an example of when you refused to accept good enough and pushed for excellence.
column8: We strive to excel at everything we do. We believe that excellence is not a destination but a mindset and way of working.
column9: Goldman Sachs Culture Values, Leadership Development Program, 2024

column4: Build long-term relationships based on trust and value
column5: Tell me about how you've built and maintained a complex client relationship over time.
column8: Long-term client relationships are built on trust, transparency, and consistent value delivery. This is the foundation of our franchise.
column9: John Waldron, President & COO, Client Conference, 2023

column4: Serve clients with excellence and integrity
column5: Tell me about a time when you went above and beyond to help a client succeed.
column8: We strive to be the most respected financial services firm in the world by serving our clients with excellence and integrity.
column9: JPMorgan Chase Code of Conduct, Employee Handbook, 2024

column4: Execute with precision and continuous improvement
column5: Describe how you've improved an operational process to increase efficiency.
column8: Operational excellence is about executing with precision, continuous improvement, and maintaining the highest standards of risk management.
column9: Jamie Dimon, CEO Letter to Shareholders, 2023

column4: Make decisions based on what's right
column5: Give me an example of when you made a difficult decision based on ethical principles.
column8: Integrity is doing the right thing even when no one is watching. It's fundamental to who we are and how we operate.
column9: JPMorgan Chase Business Principles, Compliance Training, 2024

column4: Lead client-centric solutions and innovation
column5: Tell me about a time when you led innovation to better serve clients.
column8: Innovation should always serve our clients better. The best innovations come from deep client relationships and understanding their evolving needs.

column4: Put clients at the center of everything we do
column5: Tell me about a time when you made a decision that prioritized client outcomes.
column8: Client centricity means putting our clients at the center of everything we do and creating long-term value for them.
column9: Deutsche Bank Values, Company Culture Guide, 2024

column4: Balance short-term results with long-term value
column5: Describe how you've balanced competing priorities to achieve sustainable results.
column8: Sustainable performance means balancing short-term results with long-term value creation for all stakeholders.
column9: Christian Sewing, CEO Address, Annual General Meeting, 2023

column4: Drive transformational change through innovation
column5: Give me an example of when you led innovation to solve a complex business challenge.
column8: Innovation is about driving transformational change that creates value for clients and advances our strategic objectives.
column9: Deutsche Bank Innovation Report, Technology Division, 2024

column4: Lead with uncompromising ethical standards
column5: Tell me about a time when you had to make a decision that tested your integrity as a leader.
column8: Integrity is non-negotiable. As leaders, we must set the highest ethical standards and ensure our teams follow them without compromise.
column9: Deutsche Bank Code of Ethics, Executive Leadership Program, 2023

column4: Understand and anticipate client needs
column5: Tell me about a time when you anticipated a client need before they expressed it.
column8: Client focus means truly understanding our clients' needs and anticipating what they'll need next to help them succeed.
column9: UBS Principles and Behaviors, Employee Onboarding, 2024

column4: Act with honesty and transparency
column5: Describe a situation where you demonstrated integrity under pressure.
column8: Integrity means acting with honesty and transparency, especially when facing difficult situations or pressure.
column9: Ralph Hamers, Former CEO Message, Company All-Hands, 2022

column4: Pursue the highest standards in everything we do
column5: Give me an example of when you set new standards of excellence in your area.
column8: Excellence is about pursuing the highest standards and continuously raising the bar for ourselves and our teams.
column9: UBS Excellence Framework, Performance Management Guide, 2023

column4: Work together to achieve shared success
column5: Tell me about how you've led collaboration across different divisions to achieve results.
column8: Collaboration across our global platform is essential to delivering the best solutions for our clients and achieving our strategic goals.
column9: Sergio Ermotti, CEO Strategy Update, Investor Day, 2024

column4: Behave with integrity and uphold ethical standards
column5: Tell me about a time when you had to make an ethical decision under pressure.
column8: Integrity means being honest, ethical, and doing the right thing, especially when no one is looking.

column4: Deliver exceptional value to clients and stakeholders
column5: Describe how you've exceeded expectations in delivering value to clients.
column8: Excellence is about consistently delivering exceptional value and exceeding expectations of clients, colleagues, and stakeholders.
column9: Joe Ucuzoglu, CEO Message, Global All-Hands, 2023

column4: Create lasting impact for clients
column5: Give me an example of when you created sustainable value for a client beyond the immediate engagement.
column8: Creating lasting client value means going beyond immediate solutions to build sustainable impact and long-term success.
column9: Deloitte Client Value Framework, Consulting Excellence Program, 2024

column4: Foster teamwork and collective achievement
column5: Tell me about how you've built and led high-performing collaborative teams.
column8: Collaboration and teamwork are essential to achieving our mission of making an impact that matters for clients and society.
column9: Deloitte Leadership Model, Executive Development Program, 2023

column4: Drive innovation to solve complex challenges
column5: Describe a time when you used innovative thinking to solve a client's complex problem.
column8: Innovation is about applying creativity and emerging technologies to solve complex challenges and create new value.

column4: Do the right thing even when no one is watching
column5: Tell me about a time when you had to choose between personal gain and doing what's right.
column8: Acting with integrity means doing the right thing, even when it's difficult or when no one is watching.

column4: Create meaningful impact for clients and communities
column5: Describe how you've contributed to meaningful change in your organization or community.
column8: Making a difference means creating meaningful impact that matters for our clients, people, and the communities we serve.
column9: Bob Moritz, Global Chairman Message, Purpose Report, 2023

column4: Show genuine concern for people and stakeholders
column5: Give me an example of when you demonstrated care for team members during a challenging period.
column8: Caring means showing genuine concern for our people, clients, and the world around us, especially during difficult times.
column9: PwC People Strategy, Human Capital Report, 2024

column4: Collaborate effectively to achieve shared goals
column5: Tell me about how you've united diverse teams around a common purpose.
column8: Working together means collaborating effectively across boundaries to achieve shared goals and create collective success.
column9: PwC Collaboration Framework, Leadership Excellence Program, 2023

column4: Build trust through honest and ethical behavior
column5: Tell me about a time when you built trust with a stakeholder through your actions.
column8: Integrity means building trust by being honest, ethical, and transparent in all our interactions and decisions.

column4: Value diverse perspectives and treat everyone with dignity
column5: Describe how you've worked effectively with people from different backgrounds and perspectives.
column8: Respect means valuing diverse perspectives and treating everyone with dignity, regardless of their background or role.
column9: Carmine Di Sibio, Global Chairman Message, Diversity Report, 2023

column4: Collaborate to deliver exceptional results
column5: Give me an example of when you led a complex team effort to achieve exceptional results.
column8: Teaming means working collaboratively with colleagues and clients to deliver exceptional results that none could achieve alone.
column9: EY Teaming Philosophy, Project Excellence Guide, 2024

column4: Create an environment where everyone can contribute fully
column5: Tell me about how you've fostered inclusion to improve team performance.
column8: Inclusion means creating an environment where everyone feels valued, respected, and able to contribute their best work.
column9: EY Inclusion Strategy, Executive Leadership Development, 2023

column4: Maintain honesty and uphold professional standards
column5: Tell me about a time when you had to admit a mistake and take responsibility.
column8: Integrity is about being honest, taking responsibility for our actions, and upholding the highest professional standards.

column4: Deliver work of exceptional quality
column5: Describe a project where you delivered results that exceeded expectations.
column8: Excellence means consistently delivering work of the highest quality that exceeds expectations and creates lasting value.
column9: Paul Knopp, CEO Message, Quality & Excellence Report, 2023

column4: Have the courage to challenge and improve
column5: Give me an example of when you courageously challenged the status quo to drive improvement.
column8: Courage means having the strength to do what's right, challenge conventional thinking, and drive positive change.
column9: KPMG Leadership Principles, Courage in Leadership Program, 2024

column4: Work as one unified team
column5: Tell me about how you've brought together different groups to achieve a common goal.
column8: Together means working as one unified team, leveraging our collective strengths to serve clients and build a better world.
column9: KPMG Together Strategy, Global Partnership Meeting, 2023

column4: Always strive to improve and innovate
column5: Tell me about a time when you identified and implemented a process improvement.
column8: Kaizen, or continuous improvement, is the foundation of Toyota. We constantly seek ways to eliminate waste and improve quality.

column4: Value and develop every individual
column5: Describe how you've developed a team member's skills and capabilities.
column8: Respect for people means believing in the potential of every individual and creating conditions for them to grow and contribute.
column9: Akio Toyoda, President Message, Sustainability Report, 2023

column4: Make decisions that create sustainable value
column5: Give me an example of when you prioritized long-term success over short-term gains.
column8: Long-term thinking means making decisions that create sustainable value for customers, employees, and society for generations to come.
column9: Toyota Way Philosophy, Executive Leadership Manual, 2024

column4: Lead organizational transformation through kaizen
column5: Tell me about how you've led systematic improvement initiatives across multiple teams.
column8: Leaders must embody continuous improvement, constantly challenging themselves and their teams to achieve higher levels of excellence.
column9: Toyota Leadership Development, Global Executive Program, 2023

column4: Pioneer new technologies and solutions
column5: Tell me about a time when you proposed an innovative solution to a problem.
column8: Innovation is Samsung's DNA. We pioneer new technologies and solutions that improve people's lives and drive human progress.

column4: Understand and exceed customer expectations
column5: Describe how you've used customer insights to improve a product or service.
column8: Customer focus means deeply understanding our customers' needs and continuously working to exceed their expectations.
column9: Jong-Hee Han, Vice Chairman Address, CES Conference, 2023

column4: Achieve excellence across all global markets
column5: Give me an example of how you've adapted global strategies for local market success.
column8: Global excellence means achieving the highest standards while adapting to local markets and cultural differences worldwide.
column9: Samsung Global Strategy, International Business Review, 2024

column4: Drive breakthrough innovations that shape the future
column5: Tell me about how you've led innovation initiatives that created significant impact.
column8: True innovation requires bold leadership, long-term vision, and the courage to pursue breakthrough technologies that can change the world.
column9: Lee Jae-yong, Executive Chairman Vision, Technology Summit, 2023

column4: Always prioritize customer value and satisfaction
column5: Tell me about a time when you went above and beyond to solve a customer problem.
column8: Customer First means our customers are our top priority. Everything we do should create value for our customers.
column9: Alibaba Six Core Values, Company Culture Guide, 2024

column4: Collaborate effectively to achieve shared success
column5: Describe how you've worked with cross-functional teams to deliver results.
column8: Teamwork means working together with shared goals, mutual respect, and collective responsibility for success.
column9: Daniel Zhang, Former CEO Message, Employee Handbook, 2022

column4: Adapt quickly to changing market conditions
column5: Give me an example of when you led your team through significant organizational change.
column8: Embrace change means staying agile, adapting quickly to market conditions, and turning challenges into opportunities.
column9: Alibaba Business Philosophy, Strategic Planning Guide, 2023

column4: Lead with honesty transparency and accountability
column5: Tell me about a time when you demonstrated integrity while making difficult business decisions.
column8: Integrity is the foundation of trust. Leaders must be honest, transparent, and accountable in all business dealings.
column9: Eddie Wu, CEO Address, Global Conference, 2024

column4: Create products that genuinely benefit users
column5: Tell me about a time when you prioritized user value over other metrics.
column8: Value for users means creating products and services that genuinely improve people's lives and experiences.
column9: Tencent Mission Statement, Product Development Guide, 2024

column4: Maintain honest and ethical business practices
column5: Describe a situation where you maintained integrity despite competitive pressure.
column8: Integrity means conducting business with honesty, transparency, and ethical standards, even under competitive pressure.
column9: Pony Ma, CEO Letter, Annual Report, 2023

column4: Drive technological innovation that connects people
column5: Give me an example of when you led innovation that improved user connectivity or experience.
column8: Innovation should focus on connecting people and improving their digital experiences through cutting-edge technology.
column9: Tencent Technology Vision, Innovation Strategy Report, 2024

column4: Champion user-centric product development
column5: Tell me about how you've ensured user needs remained central during complex product decisions.
column8: As leaders, we must champion user value even when it conflicts with other business priorities. Users are the foundation of our success.
column9: Tencent Leadership Principles, Executive Development Program, 2023

column4: Take ownership and drive results
column5: Tell me about a time when you took leadership initiative without being asked.
column8: Leadership is about taking ownership, driving results, and inspiring others to achieve their best performance.
column9: P&G Leadership Model, Employee Development Framework, 2024

column4: Act like an owner in every decision
column5: Describe how you've made decisions considering long-term business impact.
column8: Ownership means acting like an owner, making decisions that create long-term value for consumers, customers, and shareholders.
column9: Jon Moeller, CEO Message, Shareholder Meeting, 2023

column4: Do the right thing with honesty and transparency
column5: Give me an example of when you maintained integrity while facing difficult business pressures.
column8: Integrity means always doing the right thing with honesty, transparency, and respect for others, regardless of the circumstances.

column4: Drive excellence and competitive advantage
column5: Tell me about how you've instilled a winning mindset in your team while maintaining ethical standards.
column8: Passion for winning means pursuing excellence and competitive advantage while maintaining our values and ethical standards.
column9: P&G Winning Strategy, Leadership Excellence Program, 2023

column4: Bring innovation to every athlete in the world
column5: Tell me about a time when you applied innovative thinking to improve performance.
column8: Innovation is about bringing inspiration and innovation to every athlete in the world. If you have a body, you are an athlete.

column4: Be genuine and true in all interactions
column5: Describe how you've built authentic relationships with colleagues or customers.
column8: Being authentic means being genuine, honest, and true to yourself and others in all interactions and decisions.
column9: John Donahoe, CEO Message, Employee Town Hall, 2023

column4: Strive for excellence in everything we do
column5: Give me an example of when you pushed yourself and others to achieve peak performance.
column8: Performance means constantly striving for excellence, pushing boundaries, and never settling for good enough.
column9: Nike Performance Culture, Athletic Excellence Guide, 2024

column4: Lead positive change for people and planet
column5: Tell me about how you've balanced business results with environmental and social responsibility.
column8: Sustainability means using our influence to create positive change for people and the planet while building a thriving business.

column4: Lead by example and inspire others
column5: Tell me about a time when you led by example to motivate a team.
column8: Leadership means leading by example, inspiring others, and taking accountability for results while developing future leaders.
column9: Coca-Cola Leadership Model, Company Values Guide, 2024

column4: Work together to achieve shared goals
column5: Describe how you've collaborated across different functions to solve a complex problem.
column8: Collaboration means working together with mutual respect, shared purpose, and collective accountability for success.
column9: James Quincey, CEO Address, Global Leadership Meeting, 2023

column4: Act with honesty and transparency
column5: Give me an example of when you maintained integrity while navigating competing stakeholder interests.
column8: Integrity means acting with honesty, transparency, and fairness, especially when facing competing interests or difficult decisions.
column9: Coca-Cola Code of Business Conduct, Ethics Training, 2024

column4: Bring energy and enthusiasm to everything we do
column5: Tell me about how you've used passion and enthusiasm to drive breakthrough results.
column8: Passion means bringing committed energy, positive attitude, and infectious enthusiasm to everything we do and every relationship we build.
column9: Coca-Cola Culture Principles, Executive Leadership Development, 2023

column4: Maintain a positive outlook and inspire hope
column5: Tell me about a time when you maintained optimism during a challenging situation.
column8: Optimism means maintaining a positive outlook, inspiring hope, and believing in the power of imagination to create magic.
column9: Disney Corporate Culture, Cast Member Handbook, 2024

column4: Create magical experiences through creative innovation
column5: Describe how you've used creativity and innovation to solve a problem or improve an experience.
column8: Innovation at Disney means using imagination and creativity to create magical experiences that bring joy and wonder to people's lives.
column9: Bob Iger, CEO Message, Company All-Hands, 2023

column4: Treat everyone with respect and fairness
column5: Give me an example of how you've ensured fair and respectful treatment in a difficult situation.
column8: Decency means treating everyone with respect, fairness, and kindness, regardless of their position or circumstances.

column4: Pursue excellence in storytelling and experiences
column5: Tell me about how you've maintained the highest quality standards while managing competing priorities.
column8: Quality means pursuing excellence in everything we do, from storytelling to guest experiences, because our audience deserves nothing less.
column9: Disney Quality Standards, Creative Excellence Framework, 2023

column4: Always prioritize user needs and experience
column5: Tell me about a time when you advocated for user needs against internal pressure.
column8: Focus on the user and all else will follow. This principle guides every decision we make and every product we build.

column4: Pursue breakthrough innovations that matter
column5: Describe how you've contributed to an innovative solution or improvement.
column8: Innovation is our lifeblood. We pursue breakthrough innovations that have the potential to change the world for the better.
column9: Sundar Pichai, CEO Letter, I/O Conference, 2023

column4: Work together to solve complex problems
column5: Give me an example of how you've facilitated collaboration across diverse teams to achieve ambitious goals.
column8: Great things happen when diverse perspectives come together. Collaboration is essential to solving the world's most complex problems.
column9: Google Teamwork Philosophy, Engineering Culture Guide, 2024

column4: Create solutions that improve billions of lives
column5: Tell me about how you've ensured your work creates meaningful impact at scale.
column8: Our mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible. Everything we do should create positive impact at global scale.

column4: Treat everyone with dignity and inclusion
column5: Tell me about a time when you created an inclusive environment for diverse perspectives.
column8: We are each responsible for creating an inclusive culture where everyone can do their best work and thrive.
column9: Microsoft Culture Values, Diversity & Inclusion Guide, 2024

column4: Act with honesty and maintain ethical standards
column5: Describe a situation where you maintained ethical standards despite pressure to compromise.
column8: We hold ourselves and each other accountable to our standards and shared commitment to integrity and ethical behavior.
column9: Satya Nadella, CEO Message, Standards of Business Conduct, 2023

column4: Dedication to pursuing groundbreaking science to discover and develop medicines for people with serious and life-threatening diseases
column5: Tell me about a time when you had to prioritize patient outcomes over short-term business objectives. How did you navigate competing stakeholder interests?
column8: Genentech is a biotechnology company dedicated to pursuing groundbreaking science to discover and develop medicines for people with serious and life-threatening diseases. We are united in a bold quest to solve the world's most complex health challenges and serve society.

column4: Collaboration is in Genentech's DNA - they strongly believe in the fundamental value of partnerships and forming relationships with innovative companies at all stages
column5: Tell me about a time when you had to build a strategic partnership that seemed unlikely to succeed. What approach did you take to overcome initial skepticism?

column8: I am T – count on me: Employees act with passion, responsibility and commitment, with trust being fundamental.

column8: The company uses Six Leadership Anchors that show how each manager contributes to Deutsche Telekom becoming the Leading Digital Telco.

column8: As the Global Hausbank, Deutsche Bank wants to be the European champion and first choice for clients, with Europe urgently needing a strong domestic bank with global focus.

column8: Deutsche Bank aims to be a leader in sustainable finance, having facilitated €247 billion in sustainable financing and investments in 2024.

column8: The company has evolved into a science-led organisation that prioritises long-term patient outcomes over short-term financial gains.

column8: Pascal Soriot employs a transformational leadership style combining scientific rigour with entrepreneurial thinking, emphasising long-term patient outcomes.

column5: Tell me about a time when you inspired and motivated others through a significant change while considering individual needs.
column8: Pascal Soriot employs a transformational leadership style characterised by inspirational motivation, intellectual stimulation, and individualised consideration.

column8: It's about how we do things, how we work with integrity, and how we empower and inspire each other to bring our best selves to work.

column8: Paul Hudson is reshaping Sanofi into a modern healthcare company with the ambition to transform the practice of medicine.

column5: Tell me about a time when you created an environment where people felt comfortable challenging your decisions or ideas.
column8: The younger generation has a demand to be very connected to executive leadership, purpose, and to be able to talk truth to power.

column8: BNP Paribas aspires to be the preferred long-term partner to clients, and a contributor to responsible and sustainable growth with positive impact on stakeholders.

column8: The bank counts on its culture of responsibility and integrity to serve the interest of customers and be among the most trustworthy players in the industry.

column5: Tell me about a time when you made decisions that prioritized long-term stakeholder value over short-term gains.
column8: BNP Paribas is committed to an ambitious trajectory which creates long-term value for all stakeholders.

column4: Belief that value and values can go hand in hand in business operations

column8: Value and values can go hand in hand, and sees Tesco's supply chain innovations as both a moral obligation and a commercial advantage.

column4: Trust doesn't follow success it drives success through consumer engagement
column5: Tell me about a time when you built trust with stakeholders even when facing difficult circumstances.
column8: Trust doesn't follow success, it drives it. In order for shoppers to engage with a retailer, customers need to believe a business does good.

column4: Leadership comes with obligations and responsibilities not just authority
column5: Tell me about a time when you took on additional responsibilities to lead by example during a challenging period.
column8: We believe leadership doesn't come with a set of stripes. It comes with a set of obligations and responsibilities, and we are leading by example.

column4: Mobilizing people with purpose focus and alignment through structured approach
column5: Tell me about a time when you helped mobilize a team around a clear vision and structured approach to achieve transformation.
column8: Transformation requires mobilizing people with purpose, focus, and alignment through four pillars including creating top-notch leadership to tell people the vision and how to get there.

column4: Taking company from point A to B where B opens more potential than simple restructuring
column5: Tell me about a time when you led a transformation that opened new possibilities rather than just cutting costs.
column8: There's a big difference between restructuring and transformation. Transformation is taking the company from point A to point B, where getting to point B opens more potential.

column4: Building resilience through cash generation and stakeholder trust amid volatility
column5: Tell me about a time when you built organizational resilience that helped weather significant market volatility.
column8: You can't build trust with stakeholders if they think you're going to fall apart at the first opportunity. Cash generation resilience means being resilient amid volatility.

column8: Orange's purpose is to be the trusted partner that gives everyone the keys to a responsible digital world, building a digital world that is safer, more inclusive, and more sustainable.

column4: Recognizing that responsible inclusive AI requires human support and guidance

column8: There will be no AI without high-performance, secure network infrastructure. There will be no AI without the support and guidance of people. So there will be no responsible, inclusive AI without Orange.

column4: Recognizing employee motivation commitment and loyalty as greatest organizational strength

column8: The motivation, commitment and loyalty of Orange employees are our greatest strength and are the primary ambassadors of the Orange brand.

column8: Our purpose is to create Impact by empowering all to make the most of our energy and resources, bridging progress and sustainability for all.

column5: Tell me about a time when you demonstrated agility in adapting to changing customer needs and turned their vision into reality.
column8: Our customer-first mindset drives us to understand, anticipate, and adapt with agility to turn ambitions into actions.

column4: Leading industry in corporate social responsibility and sustainability performance
column5: Tell me about a time when you led an initiative that achieved both business objectives and significant environmental or social impact.
column8: The company was named the World's Most Sustainable Corporation by Corporate Knights in 2021 and continues leading industry in corporate social responsibility.

column4: Unlocking power of food to enhance quality of life for everyone today and future generations
column5: Tell me about a time when you contributed to something that improved people's quality of life or well-being.
column8: Nestlé's mission is to unlock the power of food to enhance quality of life for everyone, today and for generations to come.

column4: Demonstrating honesty integrity and fairness with customers and trading partners
column5: Tell me about a time when you maintained honesty and integrity even when it was difficult or costly.
column8: Demonstrating honesty, integrity and fairness to customers and expecting the same from trading partners.

column4: Zero tolerance for child labor forced labor and modern slavery throughout operations
column5: Tell me about a time when you took a firm stand on an ethical issue that was important to your organization's values.
column8: Zero tolerance to child labor, forced labor and modern slavery throughout our operations and supply chain.

column5: Tell me about a time when you created accountability while also fostering an environment where people could learn from mistakes.
column8: Accountability is a key tenet with clear goals and expectations, regular feedback, and a supportive environment where learning from failures is encouraged.

column5: Tell me about a time when you helped create a more collaborative and inclusive culture within your team or organization.
column8: This refreshed Management Board structure is critical to build a progressive and agile organisation with a collaborative and inclusive culture, enabling simultaneous performance and transformation.

column4: Operating to the highest ethical standards as priority for employees and business partners
column5: Tell me about a time when you ensured that ethical standards were maintained throughout a challenging business situation.
column8: I have made it clear to my senior management team and the organisation that we must operate to the highest ethical standards, and this topic must remain a priority.

column4: Vision of Better Tomorrow that satisfies consumers potentially benefits society and inspires employees
column5: Tell me about a time when you led an initiative that balanced multiple stakeholder needs while driving toward a transformational vision.
column8: The vision 'A Better Tomorrow' will satisfy our consumers; potentially benefit society; inspire our employees; and ensure we deliver value for shareholders as we create a sustainable business for the next 100 years.

column4: Considering health of people and planet as intimately interconnected
column5: Tell me about a time when you contributed to a solution that addressed both human wellbeing and environmental concerns.
column8: With its 'One Planet. One Health' frame of action, which considers the health of people and the planet as intimately interconnected, Danone's aim is to inspire healthier and more sustainable eating and drinking practices.

column4: Balancing social impact with economic performance for decades
column5: Tell me about a time when you found a way to achieve both social good and business results in a project or initiative.
column8: The dual social and economic project has been at the heart of the company's purpose for decades, balancing business performance with sustainability commitments.

column4: Enabling every employee to be a force for good while fostering welcoming supportive workplace
column5: Tell me about a time when you empowered others to make a positive social or environmental impact through their work.
column8: Danone aims to enable every Danoner to be a force for good via their B Corp journey, fostering a welcoming and supportive workplace.

column4: Accelerating food revolution to create superior sustainable profitable value for all stakeholders
column5: Tell me about a time when you led transformational change that created value across multiple stakeholder groups.
column8: To accelerate this food revolution and create superior, sustainable, profitable value for all its stakeholders, Danone has defined nine 2030 Goals.

column4: Demonstrating extraordinary ownership entrepreneurial spirit and drive for performance
column5: Tell me about a time when you took ownership of a challenging situation and approached it with an entrepreneurial mindset.
column8: I have seen the extraordinary ownership, entrepreneurial spirit, and drive for performance that our people demonstrate every day.

column4: Focusing on market-leading power brands that enjoy very high levels of trust
column5: Tell me about a time when you focused resources on your strongest assets to maximize value creation.
column8: I define power brands as when you have a very large brand that enjoys very high levels of trust. Being clear and being disciplined is really important, because that's how we maximize value creation.

column4: Building internal talent development capabilities to become more of an academy company
column5: Tell me about a time when you invested in developing others' capabilities as a deliberate long-term strategy.
column8: I want Reckitt to become more of an academy company. We have been on a journey to build our internal talent development capabilities, and we should aspire to get to levels of excellence.

column4: Rigorously embedding lifesaving rules and safety leadership principles with safety always first
column5: Tell me about a time when you prioritized safety over speed or cost in a decision.
column8: BP emphasizes rigorously embedding their Lifesaving Rules and having all people live and own their Safety Leadership Principles, with safety always coming first at BP.

column4: Operating safely efficiently executing with discipline and always focusing on returns
column5: Tell me about a time when you maintained discipline in resource allocation while pursuing multiple opportunities.
column8: Now, more than ever, our focus must remain on delivery – operating safely and efficiently, executing with discipline, and always focusing on returns.

column4: Moving from international oil company to integrated energy company while building tomorrow's energy
column5: Tell me about a time when you led an organization through a major transformation while maintaining current performance.
column8: BP's destination is unchanged - moving from an international oil company to an integrated energy company, supplying today's energy system while helping to build tomorrow's.

column3: Health for All Hunger for None
column4: Redesigned around mission to serve global nutrition health and environmental protection
column5: Tell me about a time when you contributed to a solution that addressed multiple global challenges simultaneously.
column8: Bayer has redesigned itself around the mission: Health for all, Hunger for none, delivering tremendous benefits for nutrition, health and environmental protection.

column4: Shifting from hierarchical model to empowering innovators and creators at all levels
column5: Tell me about a time when you empowered others by removing hierarchical barriers and giving them more autonomy.
column8: Bill Anderson is putting an end to the hierarchical model and putting more power in the hands of the innovators and creators at Bayer, calling it Dynamic Shared Ownership.

column4: Helping people shift from limiting mindsets to enabling mindsets that pursue company mission
column5: Tell me about a time when you helped others overcome limiting beliefs or mindsets to achieve breakthrough results.
column8: Bill Anderson calls for more leadership and less management, helping people become more aware of limiting mindsets and shifting them to more enabling mindsets.

column4: Energy transition has to be positive and desirable for all stakeholders
column5: Tell me about a time when you helped make a necessary change more appealing and beneficial to those affected by it.
column8: Catherine MacGregor has led the ENGIE Group with the conviction that the energy transition has to be positive and desirable for all.

column4: Strong alignment between sustainable goals and value creation to avoid greenwashing
column5: Tell me about a time when you ensured that stated values were authentically reflected in actual business decisions.
column8: The best way to hold business accountable is to verify that our sustainable goals are truly aligned with how we create value. If you want to avoid greenwashing, you need strong alignment.

column4: Transition represents new form of growth that is more inclusive shared and responsible
column5: Tell me about a time when you designed growth strategies that specifically included and benefited multiple stakeholder groups.
column8: Transition is not degrowth. On the contrary, it represents a new form of growth - more inclusive, more shared, more responsible!

column4: Considering social impact and responsibilities toward customers and communities
column5: Tell me about a time when you balanced commercial objectives with social and societal responsibilities.
column8: The Group has social and societal responsibilities and must consider the impact of price rises on customers, while maintaining energy as a key sovereignty issue.

column4: Maintaining craftsmanship and history while changing what needs to be changed to remain relevant
column5: Tell me about a time when you preserved important traditions while adapting to new requirements or circumstances.

column4: Never compromising integrity of product for increased production when craftsmanship and authenticity are key
column5: Tell me about a time when you chose to maintain quality standards even when there was pressure to increase volume or speed.

column8: Hermes does not have a marketing department, product development being solely based on the freedom of creativity, because we are craftsmen and not industry.

column4: Group Essential values including diversity pride and bravery in all decisions

column4: Being confident about providing meaningful answers and staying strong today and tomorrow

column4: Working atmosphere of mutual appreciation with room for maneuver and personal responsibility
column5: Tell me about a time when you created or contributed to an appreciative work environment where people felt valued.

column4: Sense of family as one of four core cultural values alongside pioneering spirit and sportiness

column4: Freedom as umbrella under which every action and new idea is cultivated and nurtured

column5: Tell me about a time when you operated with autonomy while still contributing to broader organizational objectives.
column8: LVMH's decentralized management allows its brands to operate autonomously, promoting quick customer understanding and innovation.

column5: Tell me about a time when you found success by avoiding extremes and taking a balanced approach to competing alternatives.

column8: BASF operates under their CORE values framework where C represents Creative and O represents Open to new ideas and approaches.

column4: Mission to forever make life easier for people and enrich their lives
column5: Tell me about a time when you helped make someone's life easier or better through your work or actions.
column8: Forever making life easier for people and enriching it is our mission, taking responsibility to society and environment very seriously.

column4: Wanting to be European champion and first choice for clients while maintaining global focus
column5: Tell me about a time when you represented your team or organization with pride while working with international partners.
column8: As the Global Hausbank, Deutsche Bank wants to be the European champion and first choice for clients, with Europe urgently needing a strong domestic bank with global focus.

column4: Values-based culture grounded in ethics and integrity with clear expectations and independent oversight
column5: Tell me about a time when you made a decision based on your values even when it wasn't the easiest choice.
column8: They ensure robust governance through their Values-based culture grounded in ethics and integrity and supported by clear expectations outlined in policies and standards.

column4: Trying to get medicines to everybody who needs them across all countries

column8: We try and get medicines to everybody who needs them. We ship medicines to all countries; we try and do our best to make sure every patient gets what they need.

column8: BNP Paribas fosters a stimulating workplace where people are treated fairly and with respect, aiming to offer colleagues an inspiring and stimulating place to work.

column4: Stores acting as community hubs with responsibility that comes from company size
column5: Tell me about a time when you took on responsibility to serve your local community beyond your basic job requirements.
column8: Murphy said that the stores now acted as community hubs, a responsibility that he said comes from the company's size, demonstrating Tesco's commitment to local communities.

column4: Driving high-performance culture while delivering results for all stakeholders
column5: Tell me about a time when you contributed to a high-performance environment while ensuring everyone benefited.
column8: Rolls-Royce chair described Tufan as having the ability to drive a high-performance culture and deliver results for investors while maintaining stakeholder focus.

column4: Supporting children in informed use of digital technology and protecting from digital threats
column5: Tell me about a time when you helped someone learn to use technology safely and effectively.
column8: The For Good Connections initiative supports children in the informed use of digital technology and helps protect them from digital threats, reaffirming Orange's commitment to responsible digital use.

column4: Embracing diversity and inclusion with wellbeing respect and inclusion embedded in business
column5: Tell me about a time when you made sure everyone felt included and respected in a group or team setting.
column8: We embrace diversity and inclusion in everything we do. Diversity, well-being, respect, and inclusion are embedded in our business.

column8: Key principles include preserving the planet for future generations and demonstrating honesty, integrity and fairness to customers.

column4: Strong culture respecting both diversity and inclusivity as fundamental to company purpose

column8: I have tremendous admiration for Danone's strong and unique people culture which respects both diversity and inclusivity as fundamental to company purpose.

column5: Tell me about a time when your diverse experience or background helped you navigate a challenging situation.
column8: BP describes itself as globally diversified with an integrated model built for resilience and deep experience navigating economic uncertainty.

column4: Delivering tremendous benefits for nutrition health and environmental protection of the world
column5: Tell me about a time when your work contributed to helping people's health, nutrition, or environmental wellbeing.
column8: Bayer is an innovative company that is already delivering tremendous benefits for the nutrition, health and environmental protection of the world.

column4: Calling for Europe-wide energy policy recognizing importance of gas in energy mix
column5: Tell me about a time when you advocated for a balanced approach to solve a complex problem.
column8: Catherine MacGregor called for a Europe-wide energy policy, pointing out the importance of gas in the European energy mix for a balanced approach.

column4: Making progress when possible and sitting tight when things are difficult in unstable world
column5: Tell me about a time when you showed resilience and adapted your approach based on changing circumstances.
column8: We live in an unstable world, and therefore it is important to be a resilient company that makes progress when it is possible, and sits tight when things are difficult.

column4: Positioning company setup for the future while addressing operational challenges of today
column5: Tell me about a time when you balanced immediate needs with long-term strategic planning.
column8: Looking at our key priorities, we want to put the Company in the right configuration for the future while addressing operational challenges of today.

column4: Building trust with communities through frank open discussion in early stages of projects
column5: Tell me about a time when you built trust with stakeholders through transparent communication.
column8: BMW seeks frank and open discussion with residents in the early stages of projects, explaining sustainable designs and advantages to communities. This is how we build trust.

column4: Having pioneering spirit as part of appreciative culture with lifelong learning focus
column5: Tell me about a time when you pioneered something new or took initiative to learn and grow.
column8: With a view to the future of mobility, they need an appreciative culture in which a pioneering spirit and lifelong learning can grow and thrive.

column4: Taking personal responsibility seriously while blossoming within creative freedom
column5: Tell me about a time when you took personal responsibility for a result while having creative freedom to achieve it.
column8: We blossom within our creative freedom, take our personal responsibility seriously, and thus benefit together from our organizational independence.

column4: Winning mindset as fuel that drives to peak performance with passion for being the best
column5: Tell me about a time when your passion and determination to be the best drove you to achieve excellent results.
column8: A winning mindset is the fuel that drives us to peak performance. We want to be the best at what we do with passion for excellence.

column4: Agile decentralized organization that encourages efficiency responsiveness and individual initiative
column5: Tell me about a time when you demonstrated agility and responsiveness to quickly address a changing situation.
column8: LVMH has an agile and decentralized organization that encourages efficiency and responsiveness while stimulating individual initiative.

column4: Investing more than €1.3 billion per year in R&I more than top three competitors combined
column5: Tell me about a time when you made a significant investment in innovation or research that others might have questioned.
column8: We're investing more than €1.3 billion per year in R&I, more than our top three competitors combined, because no one spends on innovation like we do.

column4: For the first time in Shell's history having more women than men on Executive Committee
column5: Tell me about a time when you achieved a significant milestone in diversity or representation that had never been reached before.
column8: As of January 1, 2024, for the first time in Shell's history, they have more women than men on their Executive Committee.

column4: Leaders playing key role in compliance culture by embodying and communicating values internally and externally
column5: Tell me about a time when you led by example to establish or reinforce important values in your organization.
column8: Leaders play a key role in our compliance culture by embodying and communicating our values both internally and externally, with special workshops for senior executives.

column4: Needing pragmatic market-based solutions that reflect scientific and economic realities rather than rigid policies
column5: Tell me about a time when you found practical solutions that balanced multiple complex requirements and realities.
column8: We need to focus on pragmatic, market-based solutions that reflect scientific and economic realities, rather than imposing dogmatic and rigid policies.

column4: Either working together or facing failure with no middle ground in many areas
column5: Tell me about a time when collaboration was absolutely essential for success and failure wasn't an option.
column8: In many areas, the choice is clear: either we work together, or we die — in any case, we risk sidelining ourselves.

column4: Building for tomorrow by taking long view and focusing on sustainable interests of all stakeholders
column5: Tell me about a time when you made decisions that prioritized long-term sustainability over immediate pressures.
column8: The bank builds for tomorrow today, succeeding by taking the long view and focusing on the sustainable interests of customers, investors, and communities served.

column4: Maintaining rigorous science-based long-term commitments while ensuring immediate measurable impact
column5: Tell me about a time when you maintained long-term commitments while delivering short-term results under pressure.
column8: We are maintaining rigorous and science-based long-term commitments while ensuring we are clear about the immediate steps we have to take.

column4: Reducing duplication and increasing proximity to drive decision-making speed and accountability
column5: Tell me about a time when you streamlined processes to enable faster and more accountable decision-making.
column8: The new structure will reduce duplication and increase proximity, in turn driving decision-making speed and accountability.

column4: Fostering culture of creativity and transformative innovation while getting balance right between freedom and accountability
column5: Tell me about a time when you balanced creative freedom with clear accountability to drive innovation.
column8: It's important to foster a culture of creativity and transformative innovation, and to get the balance right between freedom and accountability.

column4: Recognizing influence of energy prices on global policy while balancing economic development with environmental conservation
column5: Tell me about a time when you balanced economic needs with environmental responsibilities in a strategic decision.
column8: Pouyanné highlighted the influence of energy prices on global policy, stressing these characteristics as crucial in balancing economic development with environmental conservation.

column4: Aiming for climate neutrality with net-zero emissions across entire value chain by 2040
column5: Tell me about a time when you set and worked toward an ambitious long-term environmental goal.
column8: By 2040, Telekom aims to achieve climate neutrality with net-zero emissions across the entire value chain with interim goal to cut emissions by 55% by 2030.

column4: Measuring success by whether transformation and growth strategy achieved with over 10% post-tax return target
column5: Tell me about a time when you measured success through comprehensive transformation metrics rather than just financial results.

column4: Chairing task force for accelerating transition to net zero health systems globally
column5: Tell me about a time when you led an industry-wide initiative to address a systemic challenge.
column8: Pascal Soriot chairs the SMI Health Systems Task Force, a collaboration of global CEOs committed to accelerating the transition to net zero health systems.

column14: Our mission is to increase economic freedom in the world by creating an open financial system that is more fair, accessible, efficient, and transparent

column4: Focus on building the future rather than complaining about the present

column8: The way you change the world is not by complaining about it, but by building something better.

column4: Be open and honest in communication while respecting privacy and legal constraints
column5: Describe a time when you had to deliver difficult news transparently. How did you balance honesty with sensitivity?
column8: We default to transparency in everything we do, while respecting individual privacy and legal constraints.

column4: Prioritize high-impact work and avoid getting distracted by less important activities
column5: Tell me about a time when you had to say no to multiple good opportunities to focus on what would create the most impact.
column8: The secret to getting ahead is getting started. The secret to getting started is breaking your complex overwhelming tasks into small manageable tasks, and then starting on the first one.

column4: Always put users first in every decision and innovation
column5: Tell me about a time when you had to choose between what was easier for your company and what was better for your users. How did you approach this decision?
column8: If you don't build your dream, someone else will hire you to help them build theirs. We build for users, not for ourselves.

column4: Act with urgency while maintaining quality in a rapidly evolving industry

column8: In crypto, if you move fast, you break things. If you move slow, you die. We choose to move fast and fix things.

column4: Think and operate with a global perspective from day one
column5: Tell me about a time when you had to adapt your approach to work effectively across different cultures or time zones.
column8: We are not building a Chinese company, a US company, or a European company. We are building a global company.

column4: Continuously learn and adapt in the fast-changing blockchain ecosystem
column5: Describe a time when you had to quickly learn a new skill or technology to contribute effectively to your team.
column8: The moment you stop learning is the moment you start dying. In this industry, you learn or you become irrelevant.

column4: Results matter more than effort; demonstrate value through tangible outcomes

column4: Embrace honest, direct communication even when it's uncomfortable

column8: Electric plus autonomous isn't just better technology, it's better for cities, better for the environment, and better for people.

column5: Tell me about a time when you had to build infrastructure for something that didn't exist yet but you knew would be important.
column8: We're not just making games, we're building the infrastructure for the metaverse. We're creating the foundation for how people will interact in virtual spaces.

column4: Give creators powerful tools to build amazing experiences
column5: Describe a situation where you created tools or platforms that enabled others to achieve things they couldn't before.
column8: We succeed when developers succeed. Our job is to give creators superpowers.

column4: Build open platforms that benefit all creators

column8: Closed platforms benefit platform owners. Open platforms benefit everyone. We choose openness.

column4: Always prioritize player experience over monetization

column8: Players first, always. Every decision we make should improve the player experience, not just our bottom line.

column5: Tell me about a time when you worked to remove barriers that prevented people from accessing opportunities.
column8: We believe everyone should have access to the skills and credentials that can improve their lives and careers.

column5: Describe a situation where you had to prepare yourself or others for future challenges that weren't clearly defined yet.
column8: The economy is shifting from degree-based to skills-based. We're building the bridge to that future.

column8: We don't just deliver content, we optimize learning. Every interaction teaches us how to teach better.

column8: Learning without recognition is incomplete. We help learners prove what they know and can do.

column8: We're not just teaching technology, we're enabling human transformation in the digital age.

column5: Tell me about a time when you made a specialized skill or tool accessible to people without traditional training.
column8: Design is too important to be left to designers. We're democratizing design so everyone can participate in creating better user experiences.

column5: Describe a situation where you transformed an individual activity into a collaborative process. What was the impact?

column5: Tell me about a time when you enabled others to build upon your work or platform to create something unexpected.
column8: The best ideas don't come from us, they come from our community. We build platforms that enable innovation we never imagined.

column5: Describe a time when you approached a problem by creating reusable systems rather than one-off solutions.

column5: Tell me about a time when you provided flexible tools or frameworks that enabled others to create solutions you hadn't anticipated.

column5: Tell me about a time when you successfully managed or contributed to a project with team members across different time zones and cultures.

column4: Default to transparency in all communications and decision-making

column8: We ship the minimum viable change and iterate based on feedback. Perfect is the enemy of good and fast.

column5: Describe a time when you contributed valuable ideas or improvements outside your formal job responsibilities.

column4: Ensure seamless integration between virtual and in-person care
column5: Describe a time when you helped create seamless handoffs or integration between different systems or processes.

column8: Genetic privacy isn't negotiable. We build privacy protection into every system, every process, every decision.

column4: Help people make informed health decisions based on genetic insights
column5: Describe a time when you helped someone make better decisions by providing them with relevant information and context.
column8: Knowledge is power, especially when it comes to health. We help people understand their genetic predispositions so they can take action.

column5: Describe a situation where you built tools or systems that significantly improved someone else's ability to serve their customers.

column4: Always prioritize client needs over commission or convenience
column5: Describe a time when you prioritized a client's best interests even when it wasn't the most profitable or convenient option for you.

column5: Describe a situation where you created flexible solutions that could adapt to different user needs and preferences.
column8: Work is changing, and workspace needs to change with it. We create flexible solutions for the future of work.

column8: Space is just the beginning. Real value comes from the community and connections we help people create.

column5: Tell me about a time when you took a specialized professional skill and made it accessible to amateurs or beginners.

column5: Describe a situation where you created a solution that worked across multiple different platforms or environments.

column5: Tell me about a time when you pushed technical boundaries to achieve something that others thought wasn't possible.
column8: Real-time 3D is transforming how we interact with digital content. We're pushing the boundaries of what's possible.

column4: Measure success by the success of creators using our platform

column8: We succeed when creators succeed. Every tool we build, every feature we add should help creators achieve their vision.

column5: Describe a situation where you designed something that successfully appealed to diverse global audiences.

column4: Continuously innovate while respecting game balance and player investment
column5: Describe a time when you had to balance innovation with maintaining stability in an existing system.

column8: We build software that helps institutions use their data to solve problems. Engineering for engineering's sake isn't enough.

column5: Describe a situation where you had to deeply understand a problem before proposing any solution.

column4: Approach problems by understanding interconnected systems and relationships
column5: Describe a time when you solved a problem by understanding how different parts of a system connected to each other.
column8: Real-world problems exist in complex systems. Understanding connections and relationships is crucial to solving them.

column4: Every decision should benefit customers, dashers, or merchants in our marketplace
column5: Tell me about a time when you made a decision that prioritized long-term customer value over short-term business metrics.

column5: Describe a situation where you optimized a complex logistics or operational process to improve efficiency.

column5: Describe a time when you implemented security measures that protected sensitive information or transactions.

column5: Describe a time when you prioritized reliability and consistency over adding new features.

column8: Design should be accessible to everyone, not just people with years of training. We democratize creativity.

column8: Design is universal, but preferences are cultural. We build tools that respect both similarity and diversity.

column4: Enable teams to create and collaborate on designs together

column8: The best designs come from collaboration. We build tools that make team creativity natural and fun.

column4: Create technology that helps people form and maintain communities

column8: We're not just building chat software, we're building the infrastructure for human connection and community.

column8: Communication isn't just voice or just text - it's both, flowing naturally as people need different ways to connect.

column5: Describe a time when you provided customization options that allowed users to tailor a system to their specific needs.
column8: Every community is unique. We give server owners the tools to create exactly the experience their community needs.

column8: We succeed when merchants succeed. Every decision should help them sell more, operate better, and grow faster.

column5: Describe a time when you built solutions that could scale from small businesses to enterprise needs.
column8: Growing businesses need tools that grow with them. We build platforms that scale from startup to enterprise.

column5: Describe a situation where you organized complex information or workflows into clear, logical structures.

column5: Describe a time when you designed processes that increased transparency and inclusion in team communication.
column8: Great communication is transparent and inclusive. Everyone should have access to the information they need to do their best work.

column5: Tell me about a time when you built tools or platforms that enabled others to create things you hadn't imagined.
column8: We democratize communications. Every developer should be able to add voice, text, and video to their applications with simple APIs.
